segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes at the sink, completely unaware of the water overflowing onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long the sink has been overflowing like this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are up to no good, but she’s too focused on that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t turned off the faucet yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the edge, and she’s standing right there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the floor is going to be a mess soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she realizes what’s happening before someone slips.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are going to get into trouble if she catches them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t look away from this scene—it’s like watching a slow-motion accident.
segments.speaker: PAR
